meaningMnemonic: Do you remember the word 転がる? This is kind of similar, instead of rolling, this is more for when something falls and hits the ground. It means <vocabulary>to fall over</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to fall down</vocabulary>. Just imagine someone falling off a chair face first into the dirt and making a ぶ sound.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 転がる. Hopefully you know that one well enough to associate it with this one, meaning you can read them both.
